bunpro.meaning: Because, The reason is, That is because
bunpro.writeup: When combined with theconjunction particleから,なぜなら(orなぜならば) forms a set pattern that can be translated as 'why (A), that is because (B)'. Essentially, it is a way to highlight that a 'because' is coming at the end of the sentence, drawing attention to it.なぜならitself is aconjunctionthat is a combination of theadverb, なぜ 'why', and thehypothetical formofだ,なら. Literally,なぜなら〜からis similar to 'why is (A) so, (B) is the cause'. This sounds quite dramatic in English, but is a perfectly natural way of emphasizing a statement/fact in Japanese.To useなぜなら〜から, state that fact/important piece of information as (A). Then, at the beginning of a new sentence,なぜならwill be followed by the reason/cause, with から finishing the sentence.The primary function ofなぜならin Japanese (as opposed to simply using から orのでby itself) is to gain the attention of the listener, and inform them that important information is coming.

examples.japanese: 明日は仕事に来ません。なぜなら、明日は友達の結婚式に行くからです。
examples.english: I will not come to work tomorrow. Why? That's because I will be going to my friends' wedding.

examples.japanese: 卵を使わないで作ってください。なぜなら、私は卵アレルギーだからです。
examples.english: Please make it without using eggs. Why? Because I'm allergic to them.

examples.japanese: 彼は泳ぎに行けなかった。なぜなら、寒かったから。
examples.english: He couldn't go swimming because it was cold.

examples.japanese: すみませんが、正直に言えないんです。なぜなら、秘密だから。
examples.english: I'm sorry but I can't tell you truthfully. The reason is that it is a secret.

examples.japanese: 彼らは来るかどうかわからない。なぜなら、まだ連絡がきていないからです。
examples.english: I don't know if they are coming or not because they haven't contacted me yet.

examples.japanese: もうすぐ会えます。なぜなら、今度僕は日本に行くから。
examples.english: We can see each other soon. Why? Because I'll go to Japan next time.

examples.japanese: 今日は仕事を休みました。なぜなら、インフルエンザにかかってしまったからです。
examples.english: I took the day off today. Why? Because I caught the flu.

dojg.description: A structure used to introduce a reason for the statement in the preceding sentence.

examples.japanese: (ks).彼はみんなに好かれている。なぜなら(ば)、誰にでも親切だからだ。
examples.english: Everybody likes him. The reason is that he is kind to  everybody.

examples.japanese: (a).私は自分が好きです。なぜならば、今を自由に生きているからです。
examples.english: I like myself. The reason is that I am living freely in the  moment.

examples.japanese: (b).ゲームにおいて最も重要な要素は、目的です。なぜならば、ゲームは本能ではなく理性で行われるものだからです。
examples.english: The most important element of a game is the objective. This is  because games are played not by instinct but by reason.

examples.japanese: (c).外国語学習者は物事を考える時、自分の母語で考える。なぜならば、目標言語では考えがまとめられないからだ。
examples.english: People who are learning a foreign language think in their  mother tongue (literally: when they think). The reason is that they cannot  think coherently in the target language.

examples.japanese: (d).変化を遂げない経営は当然効率が悪くなります。なぜならば顧客も競合他社も常に変化しているからです。
examples.english: Management that doesn't change will become ineffective, as a  matter of course. The reason is that both customers and competitors are always  changing.

examples.japanese: (e).近現代の日本が本当に正しい道を歩んできたのかどうかは吟味に値する。なぜならば、その過程で日本が失ったものも多いからである。
examples.english: Whether modern Japan has actually been taking the right path  should be examined. The reason is that Japan has lost many things during that  process.
